action.action-desc: Mr. Cohen (for himself, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, and Mr. Ellison) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to increase the amount of loan forgiveness for which teachers in teacher shortage areas are eligible.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Maximizing Opportunities and Retaining Experienced Teachers Act or the MORE Act .

section.header: Loan forgiveness for teachers in teacher shortage areas

subsection.text: Section 428J of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1078–10) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Additional amounts for teachers in teacher shortage areas
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding the amount specified in paragraph (1), the aggregate amount that the Secretary shall repay under this section shall be not more than $17,500 in the case of an elementary school or secondary school teacher who meets the requirements of subsection (b), except that in lieu of being employed in a school or location described in paragraph (1)(A) of subsection (b), the teacher has been employed in a teacher shortage area (as defined in section 682.210(q)(5) of title 34, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of the Maximizing Opportunities and Retaining Experienced Teachers Act)).
in subsection (g)(1)(A), by inserting or subsection (c)(4) after subsection (b)(1)(A).

subsection.text: Section 460 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087j) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Additional amounts for teachers in teacher shortage areas
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding the amount specified in paragraph (1), the aggregate amount that the Secretary shall repay under this section shall be not more than $17,500 in the case of an elementary school or secondary school teacher who meets the requirements of subsection (b), except that in lieu of being employed in a school or location described in paragraph (1)(A) of subsection (b), the teacher has been employed in a teacher shortage area (as defined in section 682.210(q)(5) of title 34, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of the Maximizing Opportunities and Retaining Experienced Teachers Act)).
in subsection (g)(1)(A), by inserting or subsection (c)(4) after subsection (b)(1)(A).
